code: @Manual{,   title = {stcsanalysis: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables},   author = {Jaromil Frossard},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.7},   url = {https://swiss-transplant-cohort-study.github.io/stcsanalysis/}, }

what: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
title: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
text: stcsanalysis package contains function handle STCS analysis tables ().

title: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
text: Choose correct version stcsanalysis depending version : latest version (0.0.1) , can install stcsanalysis like : version 0.0.0 , can install stcsanalysis like :

title: Data wrangling tools for the STCS analysis tables
text: can create table using:
code: library(stcsanalysis) stcs <- stcs_read("dir/to/analysis/tables")  data_patientkey(stcs) |>    add_var(stcs,c("enrollment_age"))|>    expand_var_from(stcs,from="transplantation",by="patientkey",.var="soaskey")|>    expand_var_from(stcs,from="organ",by="soaskey",.var="organkey")|>    add_var(stcs,c("organ","tpxdate"))|>    add_var(stcs,"deathdate",from = "stop", by = "patientkey",.filter = !is.na(deathdate))

what: Generic function to add columns — add_var
title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
text: Generic function add columns

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
code: add_var(   data,   stcs,   .var,   from = detect_from(stcs, .var),   by = detect_by(stcs, .var, from),   .filter )  expand_var_from(data, stcs, .var, from, by, .filter)  new_var_from(data, stcs, .var, from, by, .filter, relationship)

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
text: data data frame STCS key (). stcs list containing STCS data frame. .var chr. name variables add. can named vector (rename) length >1. chr. name dataset stcs object chr. named vector used matching. Argument passed left_join. names() matches variable data matches variable stcs$. .filter optional argument can use filter stcs$matching. relationship chr. Argument passed left_join.

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
text: data frame new column.

title: Generic function to add columns — add_var
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ stcs <- stcs_read("path/to/stcs/dataset/")  data_patientkey(stcs) |>    add_var(stcs,"sex")  data_patientkey(stcs) |>   expand_var_from(stcs,"patlongkey",from="patientlongitudinal","patientkey") |>   add_var(stcs,"bmi") } # }

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
text: eGFR

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
eGFR — egfr_2021
text: crea_mumoll Numeric. Creatinin \(\mu\)mol/l age Numeric. Age years sex Character. Sex either "Male" "Female"

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
text: eGFR mL/min/1.73m\(^2\) described https://www.kidney.org/content/ckd-epi-creatinine-equation-2021. conversion factor creatinin 1 (\(\mu\)mol/l) = 88.42 (mg/dL)

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
text: Inker, L. ., Eneanya, N. D., Coresh, J., Tighiouart, H., Wang, D., Sang, Y., ... & Levey, . S. (2021). New creatinine-cystatin C–based equations estimate GFR without race. New England Journal Medicine, 385(19), 1737-1749.

title: eGFR — egfr_2021
code: data <-    expand.grid(crea = c(50, 200, 1000),                age = c(20, 60),                sex= c("Female", "Male"), stringsAsFactors = FALSE) data$egfr <- egfr_2021(data$crea, data$age, data$sex)

what: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula

title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: crea_mumoll Numeric. Creatinin \(\mu\)mol/l height Numeric. Height meters.

title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: eGFR mL/min/1.73m\(^2\) described https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19158356/. corresponds bedside formula: 0.413*height_cm/crea_mgdl. conversion factor creatinin 1 (\(\mu\)mol/l) = 88.42 (mg/dL).

title: Swchartz bedside pediatric eGFR formula — pediatric_egfr_2009
text: Schwartz, G. J., Schneider, M. F., Maier, P. S., Moxey-Mims, M., Dharnidharka, V. R., Warady, B. ., ... & Muñoz, . (2012). Improved equations estimating GFR children chronic kidney disease using immunonephelometric determination cystatin C. Kidney international, 82(4), 445-453.

title: Read STCS datastcs — read
text: dir chr. directory .csv files. delim chr. Default ",". Passed read_delim. lazy lgl. Default FALSE. Passed read_delim. progress lgl. Default FALSE. Passed read_delim. na chr. Default "". Passed read_delim. locale lubridate::locale(). ... arguments passed read_delim. filename chr. name STCS dataset. col_types Variables type. Passed read_delim. See cols.

title: Select variable of the STCS dataset — select
code: stcs_anonymize(   stcs,   vars2rm = c("initials", "dob", "soascaseid", "soasdonorid", "donor_dob",     "consent_comment") )  stcs_remove_emptytab(stcs)  stcs_select_organrelevance(   stcs,   organ = c("Heart", "Islets", "Kidney", "Liver", "Lung", "Pancreas", "Small bowel") )  stcs_select_table(stcs, tables)

title: Select variable of the STCS dataset — select
text: stcs list. list STCS tables vars2rm chr. vector variables remove. organ chr. vector STCS organ names. tables chr. vector STCS tables name.

title: Select variable of the STCS dataset — select
text: list modified stcs tables updated VariableMetaData.

title: Select variable of the STCS dataset — select
text: stcs_anonymize(): remove sensitive variables. stcs_remove_emptytab(): remove empty tables, () stcs_select_organrelevance(): select variable based organ_relevance. stcs_select_table(): select given tables.

title: Tailored analysis tables with main dates related to organs. — tailored_organsurvival
text: data frame.

title: Tailored analysis tables with main dates related to organs. — tailored_organsurvival
text: tailored_organsurvival(): PK: organkey. 1. patientkey: Identifier patients. Source: Organ. 2. donorkey: Identifier donors. Source: Organ. 3. soaskey: Identifier transplantation. Source: Organ. 4. organkey: Identifier organs. Source: Organ. 5. tpxdate: Date transplantation. Source: Organ. 6. glo_date: Graft loss date. Source: Graftloss. 7. pnf_date: Date PNF (tpxdate dgf "PNF"). Source: Organ. 8. next_tpxdate: Next tpxdate (tpxdate organ_order+1) 9. next_organspecific_tpxdate: Next tpxdate organ (tpxdate organspecific_order+1) 10.-18. last_[...]_toggle_date: Assessment date last mentioned filled toggle (keep: "Yes", "", removed: "Missing", NA). Source: OrganLongitudinal. 19. last_complete_organlongitudinal_crf_date: Assessment date latest crf_status organ assessment defined "Complete". Source: OrganLongitudinal.

Source: Patient. 4. sex: Patient sex. Source: Patient. 5. bg: Patient blood group. Source: Patient. 6. istreat: Past treatment. Source: Patient. 7. ethnicity: Patient ethnicity. Source: Patient. 8. ethnicity_comment: Comment patient_ethnicity. Source: Patient. 9. pre_tpx_count: Number pre-STSC transplantation. Source: Patient. 10. pre_organ_count: Number pre-STSC organ. Source: Patient. 11. weight: Weight patient enrollment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 12. height: Height patient enrollment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 13. height: Height patient enrollment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 14.-28. hla...: (Optional) Patient HLA. Source: PatientHLA.

title: Tailored analysis tables with main dates related to patients — tailored_patientsurvival
text: tailored_patientsurvival(): PK: patientkey. 1. patientkey: Identifier patients. Source: Patient. 2. enrollment_date: Enrollment date. Source: Patient. 3. deathdate: Death date. Source: Stop. 4. first_dropoutdate: First dropout date. Source: Stop. 5. first_dropoutdateaccuracy: Accuracy first dropout date. Source: Stop. 6. last_activedropoutdate: Last dropout date without backstcs. Source: Stop. 7. last_activedropoutdateaccuracy: Accuracy last dropout date without backstcs. Source: Stop. 8. last_patlongkeys: Identifier last patient-assessment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 9. last_assdate: Date last patient-assessment. Source: PatientLongitudinal. 10.-17. last_[...]_toggle_date: Assessment date last mentioned filled toggle (keep: "Yes", "", removed: "Missing", NA). Source: PatientLongitudinal. 18. extraction_date: Extraction date. Source: Admin. 19. last_complete_patientlongitudinal_crf_date: Assessment date latest crf_status patient assessment defined "Complete". Source: PatientLongitudinal. 20. last_complete_stop_crf_date: Date (latest : deathdate, dropoutdate, lastalivedate, backstcsdate) latest crf_status defined "Complete". Source: Stop. 21. last_consent_withdrawal_date: Last consent date consent status "Withdrawal". Source Patient. 22. confidental data: Optional. 23. last_complete_psq_crf_date: Optional. Date latest crf_status PSQ defined "Complete". Source: PSQ.

title: Tailored analysis tables with with baseline transplantation data. — tailored_transplantationbl
text: tailored_transplantationbl(): PK: soaskey. 1. soaskey: Identifier transplantations. Source: Transplantation. 2. patientkey: Identifier patients. Source: Transplantation. 3. donorkey: Identifier donors. Source: Transplantation. 4. organ_count: Number organs tpx. Source: Transplantation. 5. tpx: List organs. Source: Transplantation. 6. tpx_resec: transplantation level Re, Sec. Source: Transplantation. 7. pre_tpxspecific_count: Number pre-transplantation (tpx specific). Source: Transplantation. 8. tpxspecific_order: Order transplantion (tpx specific). Source : Transplantation. 9. tpx_order: Order transplantion. Source: Transplantation. 10. tpx_stcsorder: Order transplantion within STCS. Source: Transplantation. 11. abocomp: Blood groups compatibility. Source: Transplantation. 12.-18. hla...mismatch: HLA mismatch. Source: Transplantation. 19. sumhlamismatch: Sum mismatch. Source: Transplantation. 20. hlaavailable: Number HLA mismatch available. Source: Transplantation. 21. procedure_provider: Procedure provider. Source: Transplantation. 22. dontype: Donor type. Source: Donor. 23. donrelsubtype: Donor subtype. Source: Donor. 24. identical_twins: Identical twins. Source: Donor. 25. kpd: Kidney paired donation. Source: Donor. 26. altruistic: Altruistic donation. Source: Donor. 27. don_bg: Blood-group donor. Source: Donor. 28. don_sex: Sex donor. Source: Donor. 29. doncod: Cause donor death. Source: Donor. 30. doncod_comment: Comment cause donor death. Source: Donor. 31. donage: Age donor. Source: Donor. 32. donage_complete: Calculated age donor. Source: Donor. 33.-43. rec_anti...: (Optional) Recipient Serology. Source: PatientSerology. 44.-54. don_anti...: (Optional) Donor Serology. Source: DonorSerology. 55.-65. combi_anti...: (Optional) Serology combination. Source: derived.

title: Confirmed missing values — truemissing

title: Confirmed missing values — truemissing
code: is_truemissing(x)  # S3 method for class 'character' is_truemissing(x)  # S3 method for class 'Date' is_truemissing(x)  # S3 method for class 'factor' is_truemissing(x)  # S3 method for class 'integer' is_truemissing(x)  # S3 method for class 'logical' is_truemissing(x)  # S3 method for class 'numeric' is_truemissing(x)  truemissing_to_na(x)  # S3 method for class 'POSIXct' is_truemissing(x)

title: Confirmed missing values — truemissing
text: x vector. Logical implemented.

title: Confirmed missing values — truemissing
